titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Reese Air Force Base Records, 1940-1997 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Reese Air Force Base (Tex.) Records, 1940-1997 and undated
did.abstract: Records documenting the activities of Reese Air Force Base, which was situated on 2000 acres and located 10 miles west of Lubbock, Texas.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Situated on 2000 acres and located 10 miles west of Lubbock, Texas, Reese Air Force Base was named after 1st Lt. Augustus F. Reese, Jr., a pilot from Shallowater, Texas, who was killed in a bombing raid in Italy on May 14, 1943. It was previously known as the Air Corps Advanced Flying School and the Lubbock Army Air Field. On September 1, 1949, the name was changed to Reese Air Force Base. The base's history extends from 1941-1997 and after 56 years of training pilots the base was forced to close due to federal budget cuts on military expenses.
The Handbook of Texas has published a more in-depth online biography of Reese Air Force Base at http://www.tsha.utexas.edu/handbook/online/search.html

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of publications and books, files from the Public Affairs office and Historian's office and scrapbook material from the Officers Wives' Club pertaining to Reese Air Force Base as a military base in Lubbock, Texas, for 56 years. The bulk of the collection consists of wing histories and public affairs materials.

arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following ten series: Closure and Reuse, Environment, Fact Books and Environment, Historian's Office Files, Memorabilia, News Clipping Files, Public Relations, Publications, Scrapbooks, and Wing Histories.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Organizations)
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army Air Forces. Flying Training Command

controlaccess.head: Places
controlaccess.geogname: Reese Air Force Base (Tex.)--Officials and employees

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Reese Air Force Base Records, 1940-1997 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

bibliography.head: Additional Sources
bibliography.bibref: Wings over America: Lubbock Army Air Field, Army Air Forces Training Command. Baton Rouge, La.: Army and Navy Pub. Co. of Louisiana, 1943.
